org.diet4j.core

Class AbstractModuleRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diet4j.core.ModuleRegistry
      • org.diet4j.core.AbstractModuleRegistry
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractScanningModuleRegistry

    public abstract class AbstractModuleRegistry
extends ModuleRegistry
    Collects functionality common to implementations of ModuleRegistry.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • determineSingleResolutionCandidate

        public final ModuleMeta determineSingleResolutionCandidate(ModuleRequirement req)
                                                    throws ModuleResolutionCandidateNotUniqueException
        Convenience method to determine the one and only ModuleMeta that is the only candidate to resolve a Module dependency, based on the knowledge of this ModuleRegistry. If there is more or less than one match, thrown an Exception.
        Specified by:
        determineSingleResolutionCandidate in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        req - the ModuleRequirement that we attempt to resolve
        Returns:
        the ModuleMeta that is the only candidate for the resolution of the ModuleRequirement
        Throws:
        ModuleResolutionCandidateNotUniqueException - thrown if there were fewer or more than one ModuleMeta found

      • resolve

        public final Module resolve(ModuleMeta meta)
                     throws ModuleNotFoundException,
                            ModuleResolutionException
        Recursively resolve this ModuleMeta into a Module.
        Specified by:
        resolve in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        meta - the ModuleMeta to resolve
        Returns:
        the resolved Module.
        Throws:
        ModuleNotFoundException - thrown if the Module could not be found
        ModuleResolutionException - thrown if the Module could not be resolved

      • resolve

        public final Module resolve(ModuleMeta meta,
                            boolean recursive)
                     throws ModuleNotFoundException,
                            ModuleResolutionException
        Resolve this ModuleMeta into a Module.
        Specified by:
        resolve in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        meta - the ModuleMeta to resolve
        recursive - resolve recursively if set to true
        Returns:
        the resolved Module.
        Throws:
        ModuleNotFoundException - thrown if the Module could not be found
        ModuleResolutionException - thrown if the Module could not be resolved

      • getResolutionOf

        public final Module getResolutionOf(ModuleMeta meta)
        Determine whether a certain ModuleMeta is resolved already, and if so, return it. Do not attempt to resolve.
        Specified by:
        getResolutionOf in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        meta - the ModuleMeta whose resolution we check
        Returns:
        the Module to which the ModuleMeta has been resolved already, or null if not

      • determineDependencies

        public final Module[] determineDependencies(Module theModule)
        Given a Module, this allows us to determine which other Modules it depends on. This is similar to the result of determineResolutionCandidates(), except that this returns one resolved Module for each dependency, not a set of ModuleMetas that may or may not be resolvable.
        Specified by:
        determineDependencies in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        theModule - the Module whose dependencies we want to determine
        Returns:
        the set of Modules that this Module depends on
        See Also:
        ModuleRegistry.determineUses(org.diet4j.core.Module)

      • determineUses

        public final Module[] determineUses(Module theModule)
        Given a Module, this allows us to determine which other Modules use it. This is the inverse relationship found by determineDependencies. However, unlike determineDependencies, the returned values may change dramatically during operation of the system as additional Modules become users.
        Specified by:
        determineUses in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        theModule - the Module whose uses we want to determine
        Returns:
        the set of Modules that this Module currently is used by
        See Also:
        ModuleRegistry.determineDependencies(org.diet4j.core.Module)

      • createClassLoader

        protected ClassLoader createClassLoader(Module module,
                                        ClassLoader parentClassLoader)
        ModuleRegistries can also acts as a factory for the Modules' ClassLoaders.
        Specified by:
        createClassLoader in class ModuleRegistry
        Parameters:
        module - the Module for which to create a ClassLoader
        parentClassLoader - the ClassLoader to use as the parent ClassLoader
        Returns:
        the ClassLoader to use with the Module
